section.name: Introduction
section.p:
CAS (Central Authentication Service) is a single sign-on protocol for the web. Its purpose is to permit a user to access multiple applications while providing their credentials (such as userid and password) only once. It also allows web applications to authenticate users without gaining access to a user's security credentials, such as a password. The name CAS also refers to a software package that implements this protocol.
This document presents the different operations to enable CAS with Silverpeas :

ul.li: Installing a CAS Server on Tomcat

section.p: For the rest of this document ServerA will be the CAS Server, and ServerB will be the Silverpeas Server.
For more informations on CAS you can read Wikipedia's article or go to CAS website.
